void ADC_AWDConfig ( HT_ADC_TypeDef *  HT_ADCn,
u32  ADC_AWD_x 
)

Enable or Disable Lower/Upper threshold warning of the analog watchdog on single/all channels.

Parameters:
HT_ADCn,:where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
ADC_AWD_x,:This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • ADC_AWD_DISABLE :
  • ADC_AWD_ALL_LOWER :
  • ADC_AWD_ALL_UPPER :
  • ADC_AWD_ALL_LOWER_UPPER :
  • ADC_AWD_SINGLE_LOWER :
  • ADC_AWD_SINGLE_UPPER :
  • ADC_AWD_SINGLE_LOWER_UPPER :
Return values:
None

void ADC_AWDSingleChannelConfig ( HT_ADC_TypeDef *  HT_ADCn,
u8  ADC_CH_n 
)

Configure the analog watchdog that guards single channel.

Parameters:
HT_ADCn,:where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
ADC_CH_n,:where n must between 0 ~ m (m represent the maximum external ADC input channel).
Return values:
None
Parameters:
HT_ADCn,:where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
ADC_CH_n,:where n must between 0 ~ 7
Return values:
None

Definition at line 434 of file ht32f5xxxx_adc.c.

void ADC_AWDThresholdsConfig ( HT_ADC_TypeDef *  HT_ADCn,
u16  UPPER,
u16  LOWER 
)

Configure the high and low thresholds of the analog watchdog.

Parameters:
HT_ADCn,:where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
UPPER,:must between 0x0000 ~ 0x0FFF
LOWER,:must between 0x0000 ~ 0x0FFF
Return values:
None

Definition at line 450 of file ht32f5xxxx_adc.c.

void ADC_ChannelDataAlign ( HT_ADC_TypeDef *  HT_ADCn,
u8  ADC_CH_n,
ADC_ALIGN_Enum  ADC_ALIGN_x 
)

Configure the channel data alignment format.

Parameters:
HT_ADCn,:where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
ADC_CH_n,:the ADC channel to configure This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • ADC_CH_n : ADC Channel x selected
  • ADC_CH_OPAn : ADC channel for OPAn
  • ADC_CH_GND_VREF : ADC GND VREF selected
  • ADC_CH_VDD_VREF : ADC VDD VREF selected
ADC_ALIGN_x,:ADC_ALIGN_RIGHT or ADC_ALIGN_LEFT
Return values:
None

ControlStatus  NewState 
)

Parameters:

Parameters:

  • ADC_INT_SUB_GROUP_EOC :
  • ADC_INT_CYCLE_EOC :
  • ADC_INT_DATA_OVERWRITE :

Definition at line 329 of file ht32f5xxxx_adc.c.

void ADC_HPChannelConfig ( HT_ADC_TypeDef *  HT_ADCn,
u8  ADC_CH_n,
u8  Rank,
u8  SampleClock 
)

Configure the corresponding rank in the sequencer and the sample time for the High Priority channel.

Parameters:
HT_ADCn,:where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
ADC_CH_n,:the ADC channel to configure This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • ADC_CH_n : ADC Channel x selected, x must between 0 ~ 7
  • ADC_CH_GND_VREF : ADC GND VREF selected
  • ADC_CH_VDD_VREF : ADC VDD VREF selected
Rank,:The rank in the high priority group sequencer. This parameter must be between 0 to 3.
SampleClock,:Number of sampling clocks. This parameter must be between 0x00 to 0xFF.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 263 of file ht32f65xxx_66xxx_adc.c.

void ADC_HPGroupConfig ( HT_ADC_TypeDef *  HT_ADCn,
u8  ADC_MODE,
u8  Length,
u8  SubLength 
)

Configure conversion mode and length of list queue for high priority group.

Parameters:
HT_ADCn,:where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
ADC_MODE,:ADC Cyclic Conversion Mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • ONE_SHOT_MODE :
  • CONTINUOUS_MODE :
  • DISCONTINUOUS_MODE :
Length,:must between 1 ~ 4
SubLength,:must between 1 ~ 4
Return values:
None

Definition at line 505 of file ht32f65xxx_66xxx_adc.c.

void ADC_HPTrigConfig ( HT_ADC_TypeDef *  HT_ADCn,
u32  ADC_TRIG_x 
)

Configure the ADC trigger source for high priority channels conversion.

Parameters:
HT_ADCn,:where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
ADC_TRIG_x,:This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • ADC_TRIG_SOFTWARE : S/W trigger
  • ADC_TRIG_EXTI_n : where n can be 0 ~ 15
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_MEVx : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTM0_DMEVx : where n can be 0*
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTM0_MEVxDEVz : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_MTO : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH0O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH1O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH2O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH3O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHmMEV : where n can be 0, m can be 0 ~ 3
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHmDEV : where n can be 0, m can be 0 ~ 3
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHmMDEV : where n can be 0, m can be 0 ~ 3
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHALLMEV : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHALLDEV : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHALLMDEV : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_BFTMn : where n can be 0 ~ 1
  • ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_MTO : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH0O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH1O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH2O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH3O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_CMPn : where n can be 0 ~ 3
Return values:
None

Definition at line 473 of file ht32f5xxxx_adc.c.

void ADC_RegularChannelConfig ( HT_ADC_TypeDef *  HT_ADCn,
u8  ADC_CH_n,
u8  Rank,
  ... 
)

Configure the corresponding rank in the sequencer for the regular channel.

Parameters:
HT_ADCn,:where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
ADC_CH_n,:the ADC channel to configure This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • ADC_CH_n : ADC Channel n selected, n must between 0 ~ m (m represent the maximum external ADC input channel).
  • ADC_CH_DAC0_CH0 : ADC DAC0_CH0 selected
  • ADC_CH_DAC0_CH1 : ADC DAC0_CH1 selected
  • ADC_CH_DAC1_CH0 : ADC DAC1_CH0 selected
  • ADC_CH_DAC1_CH1 : ADC DAC1_CH1 selected
  • ADC_CH_IVREF : ADC Internal VREF selected
  • ADC_CH_GND_VREF : ADC GND VREF selected
  • ADC_CH_VDD_VREF : ADC VDD VREF selected
  • ADC_CH_MVDDA : ADC MVDDA selected
Rank,:The rank in the regular group sequencer. This parameter must be between 0 to 7.
...,:Null parameter for API compatibility.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 170 of file ht32f5xxxx_adc.c.

  • ADC_CH_VDD_VREF : ADC VDD VREF selected

Definition at line 222 of file ht32f65xxx_66xxx_adc.c.

void ADC_RegularGroupConfig ( HT_ADC_TypeDef *  HT_ADCn,
u8  ADC_MODE,
u8  Length,
u8  SubLength 
)

Configure conversion mode and length of list queue for regular group.

Parameters:
HT_ADCn,:where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
ADC_MODE,:ADC Cyclic Conversion Mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • ONE_SHOT_MODE :
  • CONTINUOUS_MODE :
  • DISCONTINUOUS_MODE :
Length,:must between 1 ~ 8
SubLength,:must between 1 ~ 8, only valid for DISCONTINUOUS_MODE.
Return values:
None
Parameters:
HT_ADCn,:where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
ADC_MODE,:ADC Cyclic Conversion Mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • ONE_SHOT_MODE :
  • CONTINUOUS_MODE :
  • DISCONTINUOUS_MODE :
Length,:must between 1 ~ 16
SubLength,:must between 1 ~ 16, only valid for DISCONTINUOUS_MODE.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 129 of file ht32f5xxxx_adc.c.

void ADC_RegularTrigConfig ( HT_ADC_TypeDef *  HT_ADCn,
u32  ADC_TRIG_x 
)

Configure the ADC trigger source for regular channels conversion.

Parameters:
HT_ADCn,:where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
ADC_TRIG_x,:This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • ADC_TRIG_SOFTWARE : S/W trigger
  • ADC_TRIG_EXTI_n : where n can be 0 ~ 15
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_MTO : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH0O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH1O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH2O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH3O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_MTO : where n can be 0 ~ 1
  • ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH0O : where n can be 0 ~ 1
  • ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH1O : where n can be 0 ~ 1
  • ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH2O : where n can be 0 ~ 1
  • ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH3O : where n can be 0 ~ 1
  • ADC_TRIG_BFTMn : where n can be 0 ~ 1
  • ADC_TRIG_PWMn_MTO : where n can be 0 ~ 1
  • ADC_TRIG_PWMn_CH0O : where n can be 0 ~ 1
  • ADC_TRIG_PWMn_CH1O : where n can be 0 ~ 1
  • ADC_TRIG_PWMn_CH2O : where n can be 0 ~ 1
  • ADC_TRIG_PWMn_CH3O : where n can be 0 ~ 1
  • ADC_TRIG_CMPn : where n can be 0 ~ 1
Return values:
None
Parameters:
HT_ADCn,:where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
ADC_TRIG_x,:This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • ADC_TRIG_SOFTWARE : S/W trigger
  • ADC_TRIG_EXTI_n : where n can be 0 ~ 15
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_MEVx : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTM0_DMEVx : where n can be 0*
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTM0_MEVxDEVz : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_MTO : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH0O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH1O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH2O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH3O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHmMEV : where n can be 0, m can be 0 ~ 3
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHmDEV : where n can be 0, m can be 0 ~ 3
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHmMDEV : where n can be 0, m can be 0 ~ 3
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHALLMEV : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHALLDEV : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHALLMDEV : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_BFTMn : where n can be 0 ~ 1
  • ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_MTO : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH0O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH1O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH2O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH3O : where n can be 0
  • ADC_TRIG_CMPn : where n can be 0 ~ 3
Return values:
None
